instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .

threads.title: No backlight after liquid damage
threads.message:
Hi, 

I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> logic board that boots and all is ok except of backlight. There were some water damaged componentes with wrong values aroung  <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> so changed them and <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> too and backlight turned on. After a couple of hours it was off again. Checked and seems that all values are correct. The only thing i can see is that <SIGNAL>PPVIN_SW_T29BST</SIGNAL> line is shitted, some components has pins like black but there is no short to ground. 

<SIGNAL>PPVIN_SW_T29BST</SIGNAL> - 2.6V


My question is <SIGNAL>PPVIN_SW_T29BST</SIGNAL> can make backlight not work propery?

threads.title: No backlight after liquid damage
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_SW_T29BST</SIGNAL> is Thunderbolt power rail and is not even enabled, untill something is connected on the dedicated connector.

I suspect bad solders under <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>; reflow it.
However, I recommend to measure some voltage around it first.
Check <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL>, 3/5V power, voltage both pins of <DIODE>D9701</DIODE>.
Check continuity from <DIODE>D9701</DIODE> to ball A5 of <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>.
Also look if all resistors have good value and terminals...

threads.title: No backlight after liquid damage
threads.message: What voltage currently on BKLT output? I'm with 2informaticos sounds like bad soldering.

threads.title: No backlight after liquid damage
threads.message:
Checked again. all componentes around <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> and it's all ok. 

<SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>  - 3.1 V
<SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
THere is continuity between <DIODE>D9701</DIODE> to A5

Will try to change <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> by new one.

threads.title: No backlight after liquid damage
threads.message:
The voltage on out is 12,57V

Fixed. 2informaticos was right:) 

It was continuity from A5 to <DIODE>D9701</DIODE>. The problem is that the trace was damaged righ near a5 under the chip so i didnt see it before. Restored and now working. Thanks a lot
